page.title: 09Footpaths in Fairfield
page.content: Mr Must came to give us a talk and he took us for a walk. Footpaths are used for walking on if you have not got a car. They are very useful for getting home from work, to go to farms, for going shopping and for short cuts. The country code is used for keeping the countryside tidy. It sys not to play on the roads and footpaths, dogs must be kept on leads, do not throw your litter about, keep gates shut, never pick wild flowers. There are 30 footpaths in Fairfield. The County Council look after the footpaths and the Ramblers Association help too. Some farmers plough the fields and put barbed wire and electric fences across the paths. We walked down path 82, up Swan Lane and back to school along footpath 82a.
